Contradict fact: If the claim misrepresents what Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez actually said about the photographs of the 9/11 attacks.
Exaggerate: If the claim exaggerates Ocasio-Cortez's stance on the public viewing of the 9/11 photographs.
Understate: If the claim downplays the significance or impact of the 9/11 attacks.
Lack enough support: If the claim does not provide sufficient evidence or sources to support its assertion about Ocasio-Cortez's statement.
Problematic assumption: If the claim assumes that Ocasio-Cortez's comments were meant to be dismissive or disrespectful towards the 9/11 attacks.
Exist alternative explanation: If the claim fails to acknowledge alternative interpretations or motivations behind Ocasio-Cortez's statement.
